q: I alone cannot change the world, but I can cast a stone across the waters to create many ripples.
h:
“I alone cannot change the world, but I can cast a stone across the waters to create many ripples.” —
Mother Teresa

q: The greatest step towards a life of simplicity is to learn to let go.
h:
“The greatest step towards a life of simplicity is to learn to let go.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: Money is only a tool. It will take you wherever you wish, but it will not replace you as the driver.
h:
“Money is only a tool. It will take you wherever you wish, but it will not replace you as the driver.” —
Ayn Rand

q: Courage Is a Love Affair with the Unknown
h:
“Courage Is a Love Affair with the Unknown” —
Osho

q: A wise person should have money in their head, but not in their heart.
h:
“A wise person should have money in their head, but not in their heart.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: Do not think you will necessarily be aware of your own enlightenment.
h:
“Do not think you will necessarily be aware of your own enlightenment.” —
Dogen

q: Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.
h:
“Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: Some men see things as they are and ask why. Others dream things that never were and ask why not.
h:
“Some men see things as they are and ask why. Others dream things that never were and ask why not.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Growth is in a series of mistakes. That's the only way you learn.
h:
“Growth is in a series of mistakes. That's the only way you learn.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Normal is the average of deviance.
h:
“Normal is the average of deviance.” —
Rita Mae Brown

q: No one can compete with you on being you. Most of life is a search for who and what needs you the most.
h:
“No one can compete with you on being you. Most of life is a search for who and what needs you the most.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: If you want things to be different, perhaps the answer is to become different yourself.
h:
“If you want things to be different, perhaps the answer is to become different yourself.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: The most important things are the hardest to say.
h:
“The most important things are the hardest to say.” —
Stephen King

q: No matter what happens, always be yourself.
h:
“No matter what happens, always be yourself.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: Every day is lost in which we do not learn something useful. Man has no nobler or more valuable possession than time.
h:
“Every day is lost in which we do not learn something useful. Man has no nobler or more valuable possession than time.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: A diamond is a piece of charcoal that handled stress exceptionally well.
h:
“A diamond is a piece of charcoal that handled stress exceptionally well.” —
Unknown

q: It's better to stand by someone's side than by yourself.
h:
“It's better to stand by someone's side than by yourself.” —
Jack London

q: We are all different. Don't judge, understand instead.
h:
“We are all different. Don't judge, understand instead.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: You must be willing to do what others won't do, to have what others won't have.
h:
“You must be willing to do what others won't do, to have what others won't have.” —
Les Brown

q: If you want to make God laugh, tell him about your plans.
h:
“If you want to make God laugh, tell him about your plans. ” —
Woody Allen

q: Life is just the same as learning to swim. Do not be afraid of making mistakes, for there is no other way of learning how to live!
h:
“Life is just the same as learning to swim. Do not be afraid of making mistakes, for there is no other way of learning how to live!” —
Alfred Adler
